hanzi-su-wiki:
周

Значения

Вращение; круг; вращаться

Мнемоника

  • Тир 用, где в отсутствие стрельб заставляли солдат бегать по кругу 口.

  • То, что вы едите 口 — возвращается в почву 土. Всё вращается (как 冂).

Варианты

週

heisig_chinese_memo: If my LIDDED CROCK has the same CIRCUMFERENCE as my head, I like to use it as a HELMET.
heisig_constituent: circumference, glass hood, earthenware jar, lidded crock, soil, dirt, ground, mouth
heisig_story: Look more closely at your lidded crock and you will see little ruler marks along its bottom edge. This is so you can use it to calculate the circumference of your motorcycle helmet: just begin at a fixed point and turn the lidded crock around and around, keeping it flush against the side of the helmet, until you come back to your starting point. If you kept track of how many turns and part-turns your lidded crock made, you now know the circumference.
koohiiStory1: If my LIDDED CROCK has the same CIRCUMFERENCE as my head, I like to use it as a HELMET.
koohiiStory2: You´re at a motorcycle store looking to buy a helmet. The only way to check the circumference of your head is to put increasingly larger lidded crocks on your head until one slips on just right. Now you know what size helmet to buy.

周辺(しゅうへん): circumference, outskirts, environs, (computer) peripheral

WaniKani_Meaning_Mnemonic: The circumference radical and the circumference kanji are the same!
WaniKani_Reading_Mnemonic: Practice how to measure the circumference of an item by using your shoe (しゅう). Your shoe is kind of round, and it's free. I mean it's right there on your foot.
WaniKani_Reading_Info: Try to find the circumference of your shoe and then email us with the measurement. I promise you'll never forget this kanji if you actually do it.
Ru_trainchinese:
zhōu: (сущ/сч.слово) неделя; цикл, круг

Kanshudo_mnemonic: the ground (土) is wide (冂) at the mouth's (口) circumference
chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: Imagine a road built so well that it takes only a week to travel the circumference of the earth.
humanum_full_description_en:
There are two interpretations of the word " Zhou " in oracle bone inscriptions: one said that it was like Tianchou's appearance (Lu Shixian), and the other said that " Zhou " is the original text of " carving " and "琱", and the characters are like carved jade. (Sun Changxu), "Shuowen": "Yan, the treatment of jade. One said that stone is like jade. From the sound of jade Zhou." It seems difficult to understand the word " Zhou " as the parts of " Shi " and " Painting ". It is Tian Chou, and " zhou " in the bronze inscription has the original meaning of "琱", so the latter term is used here. " Weeks " because of borrowing for the country name, so they do not add inscriptions "at the bottom shaped mouth " shape, the name of the character armor Jinwen Guo often add " port " for the differentiation symbol. In the late Western Zhou Dynasty, the upper part of the glyph gradually became the same as the word " yong ". The characters of the Warring States period were mostly derived from this. Therefore, the Xiaozhuan mistakenly used "yong". "Shuowen": "Zhou, Mi Ye. From use and mouth."

The oracle " Zhou " is used as the name of the Fang country, which is different from the Zhou Guo of the Ji surname. For example, "Compilation" 6657: "Wang Ji Zhou Fangzheng (Zheng)", alleging that the king wants to conquer the Fang Guo called Zhou. Also in "Collection" 6812: "Let the multi-child tribe be better than the dog 𥎦 (Hou) Jian Zhou", referring to ordering the multi-child tribe to join the dog Hou Laijian to remove the Fang country. In addition, the word " zhou " oracle bone inscriptions is also used as the Zhou State of Ji's surname. "Collection" 22264 has a "broom (women) week", which is a Zhou woman married to the king of Yin.

The word "周" in bronze inscriptions can be used as the original meaning. For example, the word "zhou jade" in the county concubine 𣪕 means "琱玉". In addition, the inscription " Zhou " mostly refers to the dynasty surnamed Ji, and Mao Gongding: "The emperor invites you to (disgust) Jude, and I have Zhou." The whole sentence refers to the emperor bestowed such a long and abundant virtue, which can match our Zhou royal family. . There is also the word "Zhou Temple" in the bronze inscriptions, which is the ancestral temple of the Zhou royal family; "Zhou Bang" refers to the Zhou royal family and Zhou Tianxia. The " Zhou " in the bronze inscriptions can also refer to the capital of the Zhou Dynasty, such as "Wang Cai (in) Zhou."

There are "Zhou Gong", "Zhou Sheng" and "Zhou Shi" in the bronze inscriptions, all of which are names. "Zhou Gong" is Ji Dan, the fourth son of Zhou Wenwang, and Fang Yi: "Wang Ling (order) Zhou Gongzi Mingbao, Yin three things and four directions", that is, the king ordered Zhou Gong's son Mingbao to take charge of the government's internal and external affairs and lead all Qing Shi, Laoyou (Ma Chengyuan). "Zhou Sheng" was the ruler of the Western Zhou Dynasty. As for "Zhou Shi", Chen Mengjia thought that Zhou Shi was the Shi Shi of "Zhou Li", and his duty was to "guard outside the royal gate with his military uniform." Shougong plate: "Shougong to Yang Zhou Shili" refers to the Shougong's appreciation and praise of Zhou's gift. "Zongzhou" refers to the area across the river between Feng and Gao when the Zhou Dynasty was founded, which is now the suburb of Xi'an. "Cheng Zhou" refers to the Eastern Capital in the Western Zhou Dynasty and was built by Zhou Gongdan. After the death of Zhou, King Ping moved east to form Zhou, which is now the land west of Baima Temple in Luoyang.

" Zhou " is derived from the meticulous pattern and has the meaning of carefulness and rigor, "Zuo Zhuan. "The Four Years of Zhao Gong": "The Zhou in its possession." Du's note: "Zhou, Mi Ye." Then it extended the meaning of intimacy, "Zuo Zhuan. "Eighteenth Year of Wengong": "Ugly evil, stubborn and unfriended, are like Bi Zhou." Kong Yingda Shu: "Bi is similar, Zhou is close."

On the other hand, " week " means all over, such as "Guang Ya. "Explanation of the Second": "Zhou, everywhere." It also has the meaning of surrounding, "Chu Ci. Nine songs. "Xiang Jun": "Shui Zhou Xi Tang." Wang Yi's note: "Zhou, Xuan Ye." In logic, "Zhou Yan" (distributed) also refers to the meaning of universal.
humanum_short_description_en: a jade with carved oracle bone inscriptions. Zhu Fangpu thinks that the characters are vertical and horizontal, and the literary shape is carved , which is regarded as the first text of " carving " and " yan ". The original meaning is carving jade.
humanum_full_description:
「周」字甲骨文釋義有二：一說以為象田疇之貌(魯實先)，一說則以「周」為「彫」、「琱」之初文，字象有彫飾的玉器(孫常敘)，《說文》：「琱，治玉也。一曰石似玉。从玉周聲。」按「周」字充當「實」、「畫」等字的部件，似乎較難理解為田疇，且金文中「周」有用作「琱」的本義，故這裏採用後一種說法。「周」因借用作國名，所以金文又在字形下方別加「口」形，甲金文國名之字往往加「口」作分化符號。西周晚期字形上部漸與「用」字同形，戰國文字多承此而來，小篆亦因此誤從「用」，《說文》：「周，密也。从用、口。」

　　甲骨文「周」用作方國名，與姬姓的周國有別，如《合集》6657正：「王叀周方正(征)」，指稱王要征伐稱為周的方國。又《合集》6812正：「令多子族比犬𥎦(侯)翦周」，指命令多子族聯合犬侯來翦除周這個方國。另「周」字甲骨文亦有用作姬姓的周國，《合集》22264有「帚(婦)周」一名，為周國女子嫁給殷王者。

　　金文「周」字可用作本義，如縣妃𣪕有「周玉」一詞，即為「琱玉」。另金文「周」多指姬姓王朝，毛公鼎：「皇天引猒(厭)厥德，配我有周」，全句指皇天賜予這樣綿長和充厚的德，可與我周王室相匹配。又金文中有「周廟」一詞，為周王室之宗廟；「周邦」則指周王室、周天下。金文中「周」亦可指周朝都城，如曶鼎：「王才(在)周。」

　　金文中有「周公」、「周生」、「周師」，俱為人名。「周公」為周文王第四子姬旦，夨令方彝：「王令(命)周公子明保，尹三事四方」，即王命令周公之子明保掌管政府的內政與外務，領導諸卿士、僚友(馬承源)。「周生」為西周王朝之宰。至於「周師」，陳夢家以為周師即《周禮》之師氏，職責在「以其兵服守王門之外」。守宮盤：「守宮對揚周師釐」，指守宮答謝稱揚周師之賜。「宗周」指的是周朝初建時酆、鎬二京隔河相望的一帶，即今之西安近郊。而「成周」則指西周時的東都，由周公旦所建。周亡後，平王東遷成周，即今之洛陽白馬寺以西之地。

　　「周」由花紋的細密引申有周密、謹嚴的意思，《左傳．昭公四年》：「其藏之也周。」杜預注：「周，密也。」又繼而引申有親密之義，《左傳．文公十八年》：「醜類惡物，頑囂不友，是與比周。」孔穎達疏：「比是相近也，周是親密也。」

　　另「周」有遍佈的意思，如《廣雅．釋詁二》：「周，徧也。」又引申有圍繞的意思，《楚辭．九歌．湘君》：「水周兮堂下。」王逸注：「周，旋也。」而邏輯中的「周延」(distributed)，亦指遍及的意思。
humanum_short_description: 甲骨文象刻有花紋之玉器。朱芳圃以為字象方格縱橫，刻劃文采之形，當為「彫」、「琱」之初文。本義是彫琢玉器。

Heisig: Look more closely at your lidded crock and you will see little ruler marks along its bottom edge. This is so you can use it to calculate the circumference of your motorcycle helmet: just begin at a fixed point and turn the lidded crock around and around, keeping it flush against the side of the helmet, until you come back to your starting point. If you kept track of how many turns and part-turns your lidded crock made, you now know the circumference.
* As a primitive, this character can take the added significance of a lap.

「 周 」字甲骨文釋義有二：一說以為象田疇之貌(魯實先)，一說則以「 周 」為「 彫 」、「 琱 」之初文，字象有彫飾的玉器(孫常敘)，《說文》：「琱，治玉也。一曰石似玉。从玉周聲。」按「 周 」字充當「 實 」、「 畫 」等字的部件，似乎較難理解為田疇，且金文中「 周 」有用作「 琱 」的本義，故這裏採用後一種說法。「 周 」因借用作國名，所以金文又在字形下方別加「 口 」形，甲金文國名之字往往加「 口 」作分化符號。西周晚期字形上部漸與「 用 」字同形，戰國文字多承此而來，小篆亦因此誤從「 用 」，《說文》：「周，密也。从用、口。」 甲骨文「 周 」用作方國名，與姬姓的周國有別，如《合集》6657正：「王叀周方正(征)」，指稱王要征伐稱為周的方國。又《合集》6812正：「令多子族比犬𥎦(侯)翦周」，指命令多子族聯合犬侯來翦除周這個方國。另「 周 」字甲骨文亦有用作姬姓的周國，《合集》22264有「帚(婦)周」一名，為周國女子嫁給殷王者。 金文「 周 」字可用作本義，如縣妃𣪕有「周玉」一詞，即為「琱玉」。另金文「 周 」多指姬姓王朝，毛公鼎：「皇天引猒(厭)厥德，配我有周」，全句指皇天賜予這樣綿長和充厚的德，可與我周王室相匹配。又金文中有「周廟」一詞，為周王室之宗廟；「周邦」則指周王室、周天下。金文中「 周 」亦可指周朝都城，如曶鼎：「王才(在)周。」 金文中有「周公」、「周生」、「周師」，俱為人名。「周公」為周文王第四子姬旦，夨令方彝：「王令(命)周公子明保，尹三事四方」，即王命令周公之子明保掌管政府的內政與外務，領導諸卿士、僚友(馬承源)。「周生」為西周王朝之宰。至於「周師」，陳夢家以為周師即《周禮》之師氏，職責在「以其兵服守王門之外」。守宮盤：「守宮對揚周師釐」，指守宮答謝稱揚周師之賜。「宗周」指的是周朝初建時酆、鎬二京隔河相望的一帶，即今之西安近郊。而「成周」則指西周時的東都，由周公旦所建。周亡後，平王東遷成周，即今之洛陽白馬寺以西之地。 「 周 」由花紋的細密引申有周密、謹嚴的意思，《左傳．昭公四年》：「其藏之也周。」杜預注：「周，密也。」又繼而引申有親密之義，《左傳．文公十八年》：「醜類惡物，頑囂不友，是與比周。」孔穎達疏：「比是相近也，周是親密也。」 另「 周 」有遍佈的意思，如《廣雅．釋詁二》：「周，徧也。」又引申有圍繞的意思，《楚辭．九歌．湘君》：「水周兮堂下。」王逸注：「周，旋也。」而邏輯中的「周延」(distributed)，亦指遍及的意思。
There are two interpretations of the word " Zhou" in oracle bone inscriptions: one said that it was like Tianchou's appearance (Lu Shixian), and the other said that " Zhou" is the original text of " carving" and " 琱", and the characters are like carved jade. (Sun Changxu), "Shuowen": "Yan, the treatment of jade. One said that stone is like jade. From the sound of jade Zhou." It seems difficult to understand the word " Zhou" as the parts of " Shi" and " Painting". It is Tian Chou, and " zhou" in the bronze inscription has the original meaning of " 琱", so the latter term is used here. " Weeks" because of borrowing for the country name, so they do not add inscriptions "at the bottom shaped mouth" shape, the name of the character armor Jinwen Guo often add " port" for the differentiation symbol. In the late Western Zhou Dynasty, the upper part of the glyph gradually became the same as the word " yong". The characters of the Warring States period were mostly derived from this. Therefore, the Xiaozhuan mistakenly used"yong". "Shuowen": "Zhou, Mi Ye. From use and mouth." The oracle " Zhou" is used as the name of the Fang country, which is different from the Zhou Guo of the Ji surname. For example, "Compilation" 6657: "Wang Ji Zhou Fangzheng (Zheng)", alleging that the king wants to conquer the Fang Guo called Zhou. Also in "Collection" 6812: "Let the multi-child tribe be better than the dog 𥎦 (Hou) Jian Zhou", referring to ordering the multi-child tribe to join the dog Hou Laijian to remove the Fang country. In addition, the word " zhou" oracle bone inscriptions is also used as the Zhou State of Ji's surname. "Collection" 22264 has a "broom (women) week", which is a Zhou woman married to the king of Yin. The word " 周" in bronze inscriptions can be used as the original meaning. For example, the word "zhou jade" in the county concubine 𣪕 means "琱玉". In addition, the inscription " Zhou" mostly refers to the dynasty surnamed Ji, and Mao Gongding: "The emperor invites you to (disgust) Jude, and I have Zhou." The whole sentence refers to the emperor bestowed such a long and abundant virtue, which can match our Zhou royal family. . There is also the word "Zhou Temple" in the bronze inscriptions, which is the ancestral temple of the Zhou royal family; "Zhou Bang" refers to the Zhou royal family and Zhou Tianxia. The " Zhou" in the bronze inscriptions can also refer to the capital of the Zhou Dynasty, such as "Wang Cai (in) Zhou." There are "Zhou Gong", "Zhou Sheng" and "Zhou Shi" in the bronze inscriptions, all of which are names. "Zhou Gong" is Ji Dan, the fourth son of Zhou Wenwang, and Fang Yi: "Wang Ling (order) Zhou Gongzi Mingbao, Yin three things and four directions", that is, the king ordered Zhou Gong's son Mingbao to take charge of the government's internal and external affairs and lead all Qing Shi, Laoyou (Ma Chengyuan). "Zhou Sheng" was the ruler of the Western Zhou Dynasty. As for "Zhou Shi", Chen Mengjia thought that Zhou Shi was the Shi Shi of "Zhou Li", and his duty was to "guard outside the royal gate with his military uniform." Shougong plate: "Shougong to Yang Zhou Shili" refers to the Shougong's appreciation and praise of Zhou's gift. "Zongzhou" refers to the area across the river between Feng and Gao when the Zhou Dynasty was founded, which is now the suburb of Xi'an. "Cheng Zhou" refers to the Eastern Capital in the Western Zhou Dynasty and was built by Zhou Gongdan. After the death of Zhou, King Ping moved east to form Zhou, which is now the land west of Baima Temple in Luoyang. " Zhou" is derived from the meticulous pattern and has the meaning of carefulness and rigor, "Zuo Zhuan. "The Four Years of Zhao Gong": "The Zhou in its possession." Du's note: "Zhou, Mi Ye." Then it extended the meaning of intimacy, "Zuo Zhuan. "Eighteenth Year of Wengong": "Ugly evil, stubborn and unfriended, are like Bi Zhou." Kong Yingda Shu: "Bi is similar, Zhou is close." On the other hand, " week" means all over, such as "Guang Ya. "Explanation of the Second": "Zhou, everywhere." It also has the meaning of surrounding, "Chu Ci. Nine songs. "Xiang Jun": "Shui Zhou Xi Tang." Wang Yi's note: "Zhou, Xuan Ye." In logic, "Zhou Yan" (distributed) also refers to the meaning of universal.

周字的基本解释

周
zhōu
圈子，环绕：周围。周天。周转（zhu僴 ）。周匝（a.环绕；b.周到）。
普遍、全面：周身。周延。周全。周游。
时期的一轮，亦特指一个星期：周岁。周年。周期。周星（十二年）。上周。
完备：周到。周密。周详。周正（端正）。周折（事情进行不顺利）。
给，接济：周济。
中国朝代名：西周。东周。北周。后周。
姓。

［《廣韻》職流切，平尤，章。］
亦作“週1”。
(1)严密；紧密。
(2)周密；谨严。
(3)忠信。引申为亲密。
(4)合，适合。
(5)巩固。

(8)周济，救济。

(10)遍；遍及。

(12)至；极。参见“周親”。
(13)终，完毕。
(14)环绕。
(15)反复；循环。
(16)周围。
(17)旁，边。《诗·唐风·有杕之杜》：“有杕之杜，生於道周。”高亨注：“周，邊也。”一说指弯曲处。毛传：“周，曲也。”
(18)指一个循环的时间。指一年。
(19)指一个循环的时间。指一个星期。参见“周刊”、“周報”。
(20)量词。匝；回。
(21)通“舟”。

(23)地名。在陕西岐山南。为周的发祥地。参见“周原”。
(24)地名。指周初都城镐京。在今陕西西安市南。
(25)朝代名。姬姓。公元

周字的康熙字典解释

【丑集上】【口字部】　周； 康熙笔画：8； 页码：页181第36
〔古文〕??【唐韻】職流切【集韻】【韻會】之由切，?音州。【廣韻】徧也。【易·繫辭】知周乎萬物。　又至也。【書·泰誓】雖有周親，不如仁人。【傳】周，至也。　又忠信也。【書·太甲】自周有終。【傳】用忠信有終也。【詩·小雅】行歸于周。【論語】君子周而不比。【註】忠信爲周，阿黨爲比。　又終也。【左傳·昭二十年】以周事子。【註】周，猶終竟也。　又【說文】密也。【管子·樞言篇】先王貴當貴周，周者不出于口，不見于色，一龍一蛇，一日五化，之謂周。【註】深密不測，故周也。　又曲也。【詩·唐風】生于道周。【傳】周，曲也。　又【詩·周南疏】周，代名，其地在岐山之陽，漢屬扶風美陽縣。　又【廣韻】備也。【前漢·路溫舒傳】鍛錬而周內之。【註】晉灼曰：精熟周悉，致之法中也。　又【廣韻】周帀也。【前漢·劉向傳】周回五里有餘。【韻會】俗作週，非。　又鳥名。【爾雅·釋鳥】巂周。【疏】今謂之子規。又【韓非子·說林篇】鳥有周周者，重首而屈尾，將欲飮于河則必顚，乃銜其羽而飮之。一作翢。

Basic explanation of words
week
zhōu
Circle, surround: around. Sunday. Turnover (zhu 僴). Zhouzhao (a. Surrounding; b. Thoughtful).
Universal and comprehensive: the whole body. Zhou Yan. comprehensive. Travel around.
The round of the period also specifically refers to a week: one year old. anniversary. cycle. Zhou Xing (twelve years). Last week.
Complete: thoughtful. careful. comprehensive. Zhou Zheng (correct). Setbacks (things are not going well).
Give, help: Zhou Ji.
Chinese dynasty name: Western Zhou Dynasty. Eastern Zhou Dynasty. Northern Zhou Dynasty. Next week.

(7) Complete; sufficient.

(18) Refers to the time of a cycle. Refers to one year.
(19) Refers to the time of a cycle. Refers to a week. See "weekly", "weekly".
(20) Quantifiers. Turn; back.

(22) Mathematical terms. The provincial term for "circumference".
(23) Place name. In the south of Qishan, Shaanxi. It is the birthplace of Zhou. See "Zhou Yuan".
(24) Place name. Refers to the capital city Ho Jing at the beginning of the week. In today's south of Xi'an, Shaanxi.
(25) Dynasty names. Ji's surname. A.D.

Иероглиф «Чжоу» в надписях на костях оракула подобен плотному посеву сельскохозяйственных культур в поле, поэтому он означает «Чжоу Ми» и «Ван Чжи».

Сплошная неделя
zhōu
I сущ. /счётное слово
1) круг, круговращение; оборот, цикл; период (также счётное слово действий)
地球绕太阳一周是一年 один оборот Земли вокруг Солнца составляет один год
2) неделя, еженедельный
一个月有四周 в месяце четыре недели
他的女儿已经两周了 его дочери уже две недели
3) обвод, окружность, окружение; мат. периметр
其周七十一万四千里 его окружность составляет 714 тыс. ли
房屋的四周是用篱笆拦起来的 здание со всех сторон обнесено изгородью
圆周 мат. длина окружности, окружность
4) * закругление, поворот; изгиб, излучина
生于道周 родиться на повороте дороги
II прил. /наречие
1) всесторонний, всеобщий, универсальный; окружающий; весь; во все стороны, окрест, кругом, повсюду
周邦咸喜 все царства возликовали
周闭 закрыться со всех сторон
周知 всем (повсюду) известно
2) тщательный, скрупулёзный, дотошный, исчерпывающий; осмотрительный, осторожный, внимательный
周疏 тщательный и небрежный
考虑不周 недодумать; недомыслие
人主不可不周 властитель людей не может не быть осмотрительным
3) совершенный; доскональный; без изъянов; в совершенстве, в высшей степени
示我周行 мне путь совершенств показали
招待不周 вежл. о себе простите, что принимаю вас недостаточно хорошо
III
гл. А
1) кружиться, вращаться; обращаться; совершать оборот
周而复始 совершить оборот и возобновить движение из начальной точки, описывать круг за кругом
2) приходить на помощь, выручать; помогать материально
靡人不周 каждый пришёл на помощь
3) годиться, подходить, быть в ладу (с чем-л.)
不周于今之人 не подходить для своих современников, стоять одиночкой
гл. Б
1) вращать, крутить, кружить
周锥凿而为刃 вращать точило и сделать лезвие
把… 周起来 закружить (кого-л.)
2) окружать, округлять, охватывать; заканчивать, доводить (исполнять) до конца
以周事了 таким образом выполнить до конца мою вам службу
3) опрокинуть, перевернуть
天棚让风周了 навес был опрокинут ветром
4) скреплять. подтверждать
盟所以周信也 союз ― это то, чем подтверждают (скрепляют) свою верность уговору
5) сближаться с...; сходиться с...; подружиться с...; водить компанию с...
周仁 водить дружбу с лучшими (гуманными) людьми
IV собств.
1) Чжоу (местность и союз племён на территории нынешн. пров. Шэньси. завоевавших Иньское царство в 1122 г. до н. э.)
2) Чжоу (династия, царство: 1122 - 247 гг. до н. э.)
周室 дом Чжоу. дин. Чжоу
周武王 чжоуский У-ван (основатель дин. Чжоу)
周雅 Чжоуские оды (разделы в «Шицзине»)
3) Чжоу (династия, царство 556-581 гг.; на территории нынешн. пров. Шэньси: впоследствии именовались 北周)
4) Чжоу (династия, царство: 951- 960 гг., впоследствии именовались 后周)
5) Чжоу (фамилия)

周

Значения

Вращение; круг; вращаться

Мнемоника

  • Тир 用, где в отсутствие стрельб заставляли солдат бегать по кругу 口.

  • То, что вы едите 口 — возвращается в почву 土. Всё вращается (как 冂).

Варианты

週

Radicals: 周  (circumference)
Meaning Mnemonic
The circumference radical and the circumference kanji are the same!
Know your radicals, yo!
Reading Mnemonic
Practice how to measure the circumference of an item by using your shoe (しゅう). Your shoe is kind of round, and it's free. I mean it's right there on your foot.
Try to find the circumference of your shoe and then email us with the measurement. I promise you'll never forget this kanji if you actually do it.

Examples: 周り (まわ.り)
冂 (перевёрнутая коробка), 口 (рот), 土 (земля)
